text: The concomitantly increased expression of Hsp70-1 and Hsp70-2 in the cells expressing VP1 suggests that Hsp70 may play a critical role in cell cycle control. To reveal the role of Hsp70 in G1 arrest, Hsp70 was knocked down by siRNA, and the expression of cyclin E and p27 Kip1 was determined. Knockdown of Hsp70 resulted in the significant accumulation of cyclin E, while p27 Kip1 was reduced (Figures 4D,E) . These data suggest that the increased expression of Hsp70 in the cells expressing VP1 at least contributes to the reduced level of cyclin E and the accumulation of p27 Kip1 , which lead to G1 arrest.
